p: Steroidal glycosides of new and known structures have been isolated from N. sativa seeds which include 3- O-[ β-D-xylopyranosyl-(1→2)- α-L-rhamnopyranosyl-(1→2)- β-D-glucopyranosyl]-11-methoxy-16, 23-dihydroxy-28-methylolean-12-enoate, stigma-5,22-dien-3- β-D-glucopyranoside [ 24], and 3- O-[ β-D-xylopyranosyl-(1→3)- α-L-rhamnopyranosyl-(1→4)- β-D-glucopy-ranosyl]-11-methoxy-16-hydroxy-17-acetoxy hederagenin [ 25]. Moreover, alkaloids of diverse types have been isolated from the seeds of black cumin, which include novel Dolabellane-type diterpene alkaloids: nigellamines A 1, A 2, B 1, and B 2 and nigellamines A3, A4, A5, and C [ 26, 27] possessing lipid metabolizing property, and indazole class of alkaloids: nigellidine, nigellicine [ 28, 29], and nigellidine-4-O-sulfite [ 30].
